item.title: 【A Developer-Centric Cloud Architecture Framework (DCAF) for Enterprise Platforms】适用于企业平台的以开发人员为中心的云架构框架 (DCAF)
item.description:
【

Enterprise-class cloud systems seldom fail because of infrastructure constraints; rather, problems arise when architectural vision cannot scale to match the scale of the business.

With the increasing use of the cloud by various teams, geographic locations, and business units, certain recurring scenarios emerge:

】

企业级云系统很少会因为基础设施限制而出现故障；相反，当架构愿景无法扩展以匹配业务规模时，就会出现问题。

随着各个团队、地理位置和业务部门越来越多地使用云，会出现某些反复出现的场景：

item.title: 【Mastering Postback Tracking and S2S Conversion Tracking】掌握回发跟踪和 S2S 转换跟踪
item.description:
【

Accurate conversion tracking is the backbone of any high-performing affiliate or partner marketing program. Postback tracking, also known as server-to-server (S2S) tracking, offers a privacy-friendly, robust way to record conversions without relying on client-side pixels. 

This article explains what postback and S2S tracking are, how they work, why they matter, and how to implement, troubleshoot, and choose platforms that support them.

】

准确的转化​​跟踪是任何高绩效联属网络营销计划或合作伙伴营销计划的支柱。回发跟踪也称为服务器到服务器 (S2S) 跟踪，提供了一种隐私友好且可靠的方式来记录转化，而无需依赖客户端像素。 

本文解释了什么是回发和 S2S 跟踪、它们如何工作、它们为何重要，以及如何实施、排除故障和选择支持它们的平台。

item.title: 【AWS Bedrock Knowledge Bases: Comparing S3 Vector Store, OpenSearch, PostgreSQL, and Neptune for Cost and Performance】AWS Bedrock 知识库：比较 S3 Vector Store、OpenSearch、PostgreSQL 和 Neptune 的成本和性能
item.description:
【

Since July 15, 2025, AWS has added support for S3 vector stores for Bedrock knowledge bases, allowing for seamless storage and retrieval of embeddings for RAG workflows. Currently, it supports multiple stores:

AWS-Managed Non AWS-Managed
OpenSearch MongoDB Atlas
S3 vector store Pinecone
PostgreSQL Redis Enterprise Cloud
Neptune


】

自 2025 年 7 月 15 日起，AWS 增加了对 Bedrock 知识库的 S3 矢量存储的支持，从而可以无缝存储和检索 RAG 工作流程的嵌入内容。目前支持多个商店：

<标题> <正文>


AWS 托管 非 AWS 托管
打开搜索 MongoDB Atlas
S3 矢量存储 松果
PostgreSQL Redis 企业云
海王星

item.title: 【Building an Identity Graph for Clickstream Data】为点击流数据构建身份图
item.description:
【

Clickstream data is easy to collect and hard to use. Every modern system can emit page views, taps, API calls, and application events with timestamps and attributes. The trouble starts when analysis or downstream services require a notion of “user.”

In most production systems, identity is incomplete by default. Many events arrive without a logged-in account. Cookies reset. Mobile devices are shared. IP addresses rotate. A single person often appears as several disconnected records, while unrelated users occasionally collide on the same attributes.

】

点击流数据很容易收集但很难使用。每个现代系统都可以发出带有时间戳和属性的页面视图、点击、API 调用和应用程序事件。当分析或下游服务需要“用户”概念时，麻烦就开始了。

在大多数生产系统中，默认情况下身份是不完整的。许多活动无需登录帐户即可到达。 Cookie 已重置。移动设备是共享的。 IP 地址轮换。一个人通常会显示为多个断开连接的记录，而不相关的用户偶尔会在相同的属性上发生冲突。

item.title: 【Building Trust in LLM-Generated Code Reviews: Adding Deterministic Confidence to GenAI Outputs】建立对 LLM 生成的代码审查的信任：为 GenAI 输出添加确定性信心
item.description:
【

In a previous article, Automating AWS Glue Infra and Code Reviews with RAG and Amazon Bedrock, I described how I built a GenAI-powered code review system for AWS Glue jobs using a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) approach. Given a use case, the system searched all associated jobs, retrieved each job script and a predefined engineering checklist from S3, invoked an LLM, and generated a structured Markdown (.md) review file per job.

Each checklist item was evaluated with:

】

在上一篇文章中，使用 RAG 和 Amazon Bedrock 自动化 AWS Glue 基础设施和代码审查，我描述了如何使用检索增强生成 (RAG) 方法为 AWS Glue 作业构建由 GenAI 驱动的代码审查系统。给定一个用例，系统搜索所有关联的作业，从 S3 检索每个作业脚本和预定义的工程清单，调用 LLM，并为每个作业生成结构化 Markdown (.md) 审阅文件。

每个清单项目都经过评估：

item.title: 【Golden Paths for AI Workloads - Standardizing Deployment, Observability, and Trust】AI 工作负载的黄金路径 - 标准化部署、可观察性和信任
item.description:
【

As AI workloads mature from experimental prototypes into business-critical systems, organizations are discovering a familiar problem: inconsistency at scale. Each team deploys models differently, observability varies widely, and operational maturity depends heavily on individual expertise.

This is where Golden Paths become essential.

】

随着人工智能工作负载从实验原型成熟到业务关键型系统，组织发现了一个熟悉的问题：大规模的不一致。每个团队部署模型的方式不同，可观察性差异很大，操作成熟度在很大程度上取决于个人的专业知识。

这就是黄金路径变得至关重要的地方。

item.title: 【Backing Up Azure Infrastructure with Python and Aztfexport】使用 Python 和 Aztfexport 备份 Azure 基础设施
item.description:
【

In an ideal DevOps world, every cloud resource is spawned from Terraform or Bicep. In the real world, we deal with “ClickOps.” An engineer manually tweaks a Network Security Group (NSG) to fix a production outage, or a legacy resource group exists with no code definition at all.

When a disaster strikes — such as the accidental deletion of a resource group — you can’t just “re-run the pipeline” if the pipeline doesn’t match reality.

】

在理想的 DevOps 世界中，每个云资源都是从 Terraform 或 Bicep 生成的。在现实世界中，我们处理“ClickOps”。工程师手动调整网络安全组 (NSG) 来修复生产中断，或者存在根本没有代码定义的遗留资源组。

当灾难发生时（例如意外删除资源组），如果管道与实际情况不符，您不能只是“重新运行管道”。

item.title: 【Java Developers: Build Something Awesome with Copilot CLI and Win Big Prizes!】Java 开发人员：使用 Copilot CLI 构建出色的东西并赢得大奖！
item.description:
【

Here’s today’s invitation: join the GitHub Copilot CLI Challenge and build something with Copilot right in your terminal. Visit the challenge page for the rules, FAQ, and submission template.

Why I’m Excited About Copilot CLI (especially for Java)

If you write Java for a living, you already know the truth: the terminal is where we build and test. It’s where feedback loops are short and where most productivity gains come from “small wins” repeated hundreds of times.

】

这是今天的邀请：加入 GitHub Copilot CLI 挑战赛，并在您的终端中使用 Copilot 构建一些东西。访问挑战页面，了解规则、常见问题解答和提交模板。

为什么我对 Copilot CLI（尤其是 Java）感到兴奋

如果您以编写 Java 为生，您已经知道真相：终端是我们构建和测试的地方。这是反馈循环较短的地方，而大多数生产力的提高来自于重复数百次的“小胜利”。

item.title: 【Bootstrapping a Java File System】引导 Java 文件系统
item.description:
【

So, what does a file system mean to you? Most think of file systems as directories and files accessed via your computer: local disk, remotely shared via NFS or SMB, thumb drives, something else. Sufficient for those who require basic file access, nothing more, nothing less.

That perspective on file systems is too limited: VCS repositories, archive files (zip/jar), and remote systems can be treated as file systems, potentially accessed via the same APIs used for local file access while still meeting security and data requirements. Or how about a file system that automatically transcodes videos to different formats or extracts audio metadata for vector searches? Wouldn’t it be cool to use standard APIs rather than create something customized? Definitely!

】

那么，文件系统对您来说意味着什么？大多数人将文件系统视为通过计算机访问的目录和文件：本地磁盘、通过 NFS 或 SMB 远程共享、拇指驱动器或其他东西。对于那些需要基本文件访问的人来说已经足够了，仅此而已。

这种观点对文件系统的看法太有限：VCS存储库、归档文件 (zip/jar)，远程系统可以被视为文件系统，可以通过用于本地文件访问的相同 API 进行访问，同时仍然满足安全和数据要求。或者自动将视频转码为不同格式或提取音频元数据以进行矢量搜索的文件系统怎么样？使用标准 API 而不是创建自定义的东西不是很酷吗？绝对！

item.title: 【Jakarta EE 12 M2: Entering the Data Age of Enterprise Java】Jakarta EE 12 M2：进入企业 Java 数据时代
item.description:
【

Every major Jakarta EE release tends to have a defining theme. Jakarta EE 11 was about modernization: a new baseline with Java 17, forward compatibility with Java 21, and a decisive cleanup of long-standing technical debt. Jakarta EE 12 builds directly on that momentum, but its direction is different. This release is less about removing the past and more about aligning the future.

Jakarta EE 12 is best understood as the Data Age of enterprise Java.

】

每个主要的 Jakarta EE 版本都往往有一个定义主题。 Jakarta EE 11 是关于现代化的：Java 17 的新基线、与 Java 21 的前向兼容性以及对长期存在的技术债务的果断清理。 Jakarta EE 12 直接建立在这一势头之上，但方向不同。此版本不是要消除过去，而是要调整未来。

Jakarta EE 12 最好理解为企业 Java 的数据时代。
